meanings.definition: The act of making a ringing sound.
meanings.sent1: The dingdonging of the doorbell signaled our guests' arrival.
meanings.sent2: I heard the dingdonging of the wind chimes in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The constant dingdonging of the alarm clock woke me up early.
meanings.sent4: The dingdonging of the bicycle bell echoed through the park.
meanings.sent5: The sweet dingdonging of the ice cream truck drew children to the street.

meanings.sent1: The dingdonging of the dripping faucet kept me up all night.
meanings.sent2: The constant dingdonging of the machine in the factory was annoying.
meanings.sent3: The dingdonging of the old clock in the hallway was oddly soothing.
meanings.sent4: The dingdonging of the phone notifications was driving me crazy.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic dingdonging of the metronome helped me keep time while practicing music.

meanings.sent1: She was dingdonging the doorbell impatiently, waiting for someone to answer.
meanings.sent2: The church bells were dingdonging joyfully on the wedding day.
meanings.sent3: He started dingdonging on the piano keys, creating a cheerful melody.
meanings.sent4: The alarm clock kept dingdonging until he finally woke up.
meanings.sent5: The wind was dingdonging the flag against the pole in the strong breeze.
